answers.answer: Hi there, GU222Your dad had some major complications, but it seems to be under control now.  Some patients experience termporary arrthythmias and fluids on the lungs (Pulmonary edema), like your dad.Alarm symptoms in the coming weeks:  swelling of abdomen/face/lower limbs, abnormal heartrate, shortness of breath or fluid on the lungs.Your dad will now require cardiac rehab or just gradual walks and climbing steps.  Not allowed to lift anything more than 2kg's and no driving for 6-8 weeks.  Lots of rest and TLC.I was 31 when I had my mitral valve repair via open-heart surgery.  It took me about 3 years to fully recover from it.  I am still occasionally in heart failure and need chronic meds for it.  Unfortunately the heart is a very complicated organ and do not like to be messed around with.

question: My father 2 weeks ago had a aortic valve replacement surgery and a reconstruction of the aorta (they called it the Bentall Procedure - biological). He is 73 Yr old male with Type 2 diabetes. Has had his diabetes in control since his diagnosis (about 30 years ago) and maintains a healthy lifestyle. He was a smoker but quit over 25 years ago. He was released 1 week ago and yesterday returned to the hospital after having difficulty breathing again (and had been complaining about a cough for a couple of days - which we were told was normal. He now had to have almost 3 litres of fluids extracted from his lungs (accumulated in the last week) and had to have his heart shocked because of an arrhythmia (he did not have this problem before surgery). Is this normal for people who undergo this surgery? What can we expect his recovery to be afterwards.. my research and the Dr.'s advised us that we can expect a normal recovery after the initial surgery and that my father was doing extremely well but within a week he accumulated water in his lungs and developed an arrhythmia -  Now we are afraid he will be released too soon and can encounter additional issues... I feel as if I am not asking the right questions to better understand the situation. Can you help me with this?
title: Valve Surgury complications
